title: What was Madonna's first UK number one song? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to UK Official Charts: “Into The Groove” was Madonna first #01 in UK climbing to it’s peak postion on 16 August of 1985 and spending 4 weeks at #01. The song was also Madonna 5th TOP 10 Hit in UK In 1985 Madonna ended have having 8 TOP 10 Hits on UK Charts. Fun fact: That was Madonna birthday (16 August) and “Holiday” from Madonna was also #02 that very same chart week making Madonna the first solo artist ever to have both #01 and #02 chart positions at the same time. She was only the second act to do that as the only previous artist to achieve this were the Beatles. Until this decade and chart rules were changed and streaming start be taken into account for charts no other artist was ever able to do that again. “Holiday” never make it to #01 peaking #02 that week, prevented by Madonna herself. “Into The Groove” still is Madonna best selling single in UK (pure sales).Despite only peaking at #03 “Like a Virgin” is Madonna second best selling single in UK. In 1987 “La Isla Bonita” became her 4th #01 single (for 2 weeks) making Madonna the Female Artist with Most #01 singles in UK until today (now she has 13 #01 singles where 12 are ALL SOLO efforts - Rihanna follows with 9 songs at #01 but only 3 were solo efforts). “La Isla Bonita” is also Madonna most streamed song in UK.
It was Into The Groove in 1985. But it may depend on which chart you prefer to use. Both Borderline and Material Girl made it to #2 on the official chart, but they may have been #1 on some charts
